A library in the sky 
2019-09-13
CHINA Eastern Airlines has started offering an in-flight library service on its six international routes from Nanjing, the capital of Jiangsu Province, to cities including Sydney, Vancouver and Los Angeles. A total of 300 books for the in-flight libraries were available in the cabin for passengers to pick and read, according to the government office of Nanjing for the promotion of reading activities, which collaborated with the airline to offer the service. The in-flight libraries will be available in all of China Eastern Airlines’ international flights, the company said.
